bdy.p: Excela Health, Westmoreland County's largest employer, joins together 725 medical professionals in 35 specialties to provide health care to Westmoreland County and parts of Fayette and Indiana counties. With a workforce of 4,500, Excela Health offers traditional inpatient care through hospitals in Greensburg, Jeannette, Latrobe and Mount Pleasant, outpatient treatment and specialty services to rank as the region's third largest health care network.

sec.p:
Excela Health Westmoreland Hospital is the largest of the hospitals in the system. Located in Greensburg, PA it has 298 licensed beds in addition to a skilled care unit. The hospitals specialty areas include:
Cardiovascular Services (Chest pain emergency care, Cath labs, open heart surgery, and cardiac rehab)
System wide obstetric and pediatic
Behavioral Health Services
SurgiCenter
Sleep Disorder clinic
Diabetes and endocrine clinic
Pain and spine center

Excela Health Latrobe Hospital is a 198 licensed bed hospital including a transitional living unit located in Latrobe, PA. Latrobe Hospital is the site of Excela Health's child and adolescent inpatient unit as well as Excela Health's Geriatric Assessment Center. Services also include:
Mammography and bone density
Cardiac Care
Sleep Disorder clinic
Diabetes and endocrine clinic
In 2009: Latrobe Hospital will be the home of Excela Health's Center for Neurosciences

Excela Health Frick Hospital is a 102 licensed bed hospital located in Mt. Pleasant with access to acute care, award winning emergency care, skilled care, and diagnostic testing services. Services include:
Surgical Services
Sleep Disorder clinics
Rehab

Excela Health Physician Practices: Behavioral Health, Family Medicine, Internal Medicine, Cardiology, Cardiothoracic Surgery, Orthopaedic Surgery, Gastroenterology, Occupational Medicine, Pediatrics, and Physical Medicine.

sec.p: At Excela Health Latrobe Hospital a dually accredited (ACGME and AOA) unopposed Family Medicine Residency program exists. The program was founded in 1974 in response to a community need for family physicians. Each class graduates a total of 6 physicians. A Benefit of the program include subsidized housing across the street from the hospital. One unique feature of the program are during the entirety of a resident's training, they are assigned to one of three community health centers, each staffed with two residents from each class, and at least three family medicine faculty. This ensures excellent continuity of care and it gives residents "real office" experience so they are prepared for any type of practice that they may choose to enter following graduation.
